elex.parser¶

This module contains the primary Election class, as well as model classes Candidate, BallotPosition, CandidateReportingUnit, ReportingUnit, Race model classes, and BaseObject which provides utility methods common to all AP API access.

class elex.parser.api.BaseObject¶

Base class for most objects. Handy container for methods for first level transformation of data and AP connections.

set_state_fields_from_reportingunits()¶

Set state fields.

set_winner_runoff()¶

Translates winner: “X” or “R” into a booleans on winner and runoff.

set_reportingunits()¶

Set reporting units.

If this race has reportingunits, serialize them into objects.

set_polid()¶

Set politication id.

If polid is zero, set to None.

set_unique_id()¶

Generate and set unique id.

Candidate IDs are not globally unique. AP National Politian IDs (NPIDs or polid) are unique, but only national-level candidates have them; everyone else gets ‘0’. The unique key, then, is the NAME of the ID we’re using and then the ID itself. Verified this is globally unique with Tracy.

set_reportingunitids()¶

Set reporting unit ID.

Per Tracy / AP developers, if the level is “state”, the reportingunitid is always 1.

set_candidates()¶

Set candidates.

If this thing (race, reportingunit) has candidates, serialize them into objects.

set_dates(date_fields)¶

Parse dates into objects.

set_fields(**kwargs)¶

Set fields from keywords. Only sets fields if pre-defined in the object’s class.

Parameters:**kwargs –

A dict of key, value pairs to set as fields on the object.
serialize()¶

Serialize the object. Should be implemented in all classes that inherit from BaseOject.

Should return an OrderedDict.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

class elex.parser.api.Candidate(**kwargs)¶

Canonical representation of a candidate. Should be globally unique for this election, across races.

__init__(**kwargs)¶
Parameters:
  • id – Global identifier.
  • unique_id – Unique identifier.
  • candidateid – Candidate ID (raw AP).
  • first – First name.
  • last – Last name.
  • party – Party.
  • polid – Politician ID.
  • polnum – Politician number.
serialize()¶

See BaseObject.serialize().

class elex.parser.api.BallotPosition(**kwargs)¶

Canonical representation of a ballot position.

class elex.parser.api.CandidateReportingUnit(**kwargs)¶

Canonical reporesentation of an AP candidate. Note: A candidate can be a person OR a ballot position.

class elex.parser.api.ReportingUnit(**kwargs)¶

Canonical representation of a single level of reporting. Can be

class elex.parser.api.Race(**kwargs)¶

Canonical representation of a single race, which is a seat in a political geography within a certain election.

class elex.parser.api.Election(**kwargs)¶

Canonical representation of an election on a single date.

Parameters:
  • electiondate – The date of the election.
  • datafile – A cached data file.
get(path, **params)¶

Farms out request to api_request. Could possibly handle choosing which parser backend to use – API-only right now. Also the entry point for recording, which is set via environment variable.

get_uniques(candidate_reporting_units)¶

Parses out unique candidates and ballot positions from a list of CandidateReportingUnit objects.

get_raw_races(**kwargs)¶

Convenience method for fetching races by election date. Accepts an AP formatting date string, e.g., YYYY-MM-DD. Accepts any number of URL params as kwargs.

If datafile passed to constructor, the file will be used instead of making an HTTP request.

get_race_objects(parsed_json)¶

Given some parsed JSON, decided if this is standard results data or

get_units(raw_races)¶

Parses out races, reporting_units, and candidate_reporting_units in a single loop over the raw race JSON.

races¶

Return list of race objects

reporting_units¶

Return list of reporting unit objects

candidate_reporting_units¶

Return list of candidate reporting unit objects

results¶

Return list of candidate reporting unit objects with results

candidates¶

Return list of candidate objects with results

ballot_positions¶

Return list of ballot position (aka ballot issue) objects with results

elex.parser.utils.write_recording(payload)¶

Presumes JSON at the moment. Would have to refactor if using XML or FTP. FACTOR FOR USE; REFACTOR FOR REUSE.

elex.parser.utils.api_request(path, **params)¶

Function wrapping Python-requests for making a request to the AP’s elections API.

A properly formatted request: * Modifies the BASE_URL with a path. * Contains an API_KEY. * Returns JSON.
